result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephan I Roberson

records.addlTxt:
10:24 AM Defendant Stephan I Roberson in court.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Stephan I Roberson.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:22 PM Defendant Stephan I Roberson not in court.  Attorney Travis S Slattery appeared by phone for Stephan I Roberson.  Attorney Austin M Mogard in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Slattery states the bond hearing is no longer necessary today.
Bail/bond hearing on August 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

3:24 PM Defendant Stephan I Roberson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Stephan I Roberson.  Attorney Austin M Mogard in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim DMG appears in court and makes a statement. 
Victim requests a signature bond for the defendant to get help from his family. Attorney Slattery gives a statement regarding a modification of bond. Attorney Mogard makes an argument against the modification of bond. 
Court makes a statement regarding bond. 
Court denies the motion to modify bond at this time.
Bond is continued.

2:58 PM Defendant Stephan I Roberson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Stephan I Roberson.  Attorney Austin M Mogard in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Officer Jaworski is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being an Officer with the Grand Rapids Police Department. Testifies to being dispatched to a residence for a large group of people fighting in front of the residence. Testifies to seeing the defendant over a female on the ground when he arrived on scene. Testifies to the defendant walking away and into the home. Testifies to following the defendant into the home to speak with the defendant. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Witness testifies to speaking with DMG. Testifies to her relationship with the defendant. Testifies to DMG's statement. Testifies to speaking with MAG and her statement. Testifies to MAG's relationship to the defendant. Testifies to injuries on MAG. Testifies to MAG not consenting to being hit. Testifies to DMG physically stopping the fight in the home. Testifies to a separate altercation that happened outside. Testifies to the defendant hitting a vehicle.

Attorney Mogard requests the Court take judicial notice over a case that had an open bond and for an open bond in a Waukesha Case.
Attorney Slattery objects due to that case being held open for quite sometime. 
Court takes Judicial Notice.

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. 

Bond is continued.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant requesting a signature bond
Bail/bond hearing on August 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
No contact w/victim DMG, MAG or their residence
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on August 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant may have telephone contact with DMG

1:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Austin M Mogard in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stephan I Roberson appeared by video, in custody. 

Defendant's mother makes a statement.  Court will amend the bond to allow DMG to have telephone contact with the defendant.
